Is there a way to rebuild documentation for a specific tag using GH Actions? I’ve come across this a fair bit where the `stable` docs do not appear only `dev` ones do.

elements.text:
Working! Thank you.

Is there a way to rebuild documentation for a specific tag using GH Actions? I’ve come across this a fair bit where the

text: You can push special tags for every version that is missing (see the "Fixing broken release deployments" here: <https://juliadocs.github.io/Documenter.jl/dev/man/hosting/#Documentation-Versions>). But it also depends why it wasn't deployed in the first place.

elements.text: You can push special tags for every version that is missing (see the "Fixing broken release deployments" here:
). But it also depends why it wasn't deployed in the first place.

text: hmm.. if it was purely a key issue, you can just re-trigger the CI build for the tag actually

text:
How would I fix `stable`? From the documentation,

> By default Documenter will create a link called stable that points to the latest release
But this doesn’t seem to be the case? I’m only getting `dev` created,

- <https://juliacloud.github.io/AWS.jl/dev/>

- <https://github.com/JuliaCloud/AWS.jl/blob/master/docs/make.jl#L79>

text: Documenter will fix it for you as soon as you have some tags deployed: <https://github.com/JuliaCloud/AWS.jl/tree/gh-pages>

elements.text: Documenter will fix it for you as soon as you have some tags deployed:

text: I don't see any CI runs for any of the recent tags though.. that's probably because TagBot can trigger them.. you'd need to add an SSH key (can re-use `DOCUMENTER_KEY`) for TagBot: <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/TagBot#ssh-deploy-keys>
